newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's TISA rejects selling stake to other group.
newsitem.headline: Spain's TISA rejects selling stake to other group.

text.p: Spain's Telefonica International (TISA) on Monday rejected the possibility of selling a stake in the company to another telecommunications firm, but did not rule out an alliance.

"We do not want another operator in Telefonica's capital because we believe they would not contribute anything and besides it may become complicated if their interests are different from ours," Marcial Portela, managing director of Telefonica International, told Reuters in an interview.
But he added that TISA would not rule out an alliance with other communications firms. "In fact, we are currently studying a possible deal with a U.S. firm," Portela said.
The company would also be interested in an international financial institution holding a stake in Telefonica Internacional.

"We would find it attractive to involve an international financial institution in the company's capital and one, at least, would be from the United States," Portela said. "It would be a similar model to that which Telefonica Espana has now."
The government plans to sell its 23.78 percent stake in TISA, the international arm of Spanish telecommunications group Telefonica.
Telefonica owns the rest of TISA, whose principal business areas are in Argentina, Peru, Chile, Columbia, Venezuela and Puerto Rico.
